intro: Feuilleea seemannii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often with a compact, bushy habit. Its foliage is thick and waxy, which helps it retain moisture in its native arid environment. Feuilleea seemannii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
